title.narrative: CSR-facility: Let's do it right in Myanmar - supporting strong corporate social and environmental responsibility

description.narrative:
In the absence of a fully effective legal framework for environmental management in vulnerable emerging states, like Myanmar, it is vitally important that corporations voluntarily exercise their social and environmental responsibility to avoid pollution and excessive use of natural resources. The project looks to generate solutions for voluntary corporate environmental responsibility in Myanmar, while at the same time advocating for and supporting the necessary capacity development for CSR standards to be instituted.
This will be done through initiatives in three areas: 1) inputs to the environmental area in existing developing initiatives regarding strengthening of legislation and regulation of corporate social responsibility
2) promotion of public rights regarding access to information, public participation and access to justice in environmental governance, and strengthening the capacity of civil society and media to hold businesses accountable for their environmental impact; and
3) partnerships with 'best in class' corporations within environmental responsibility to demonstrate concrete solutions.
